Show HN: Flexalon 3D Layouts for Unity (Try the WebGL Playground)
text:
Hello HN! For the last few months I’ve been working on a plugin to help Unity developers arrange objects with the power of layout in 3D.

I believe layout is about more than making 2D UI - it’s a way of designing that is faster, more precise and easy to update. Flexalon can be used in world building, in-game effects, motion graphics, 3D user interfaces, and more.

I've created a WebGL playground that you can try which demonstrates how layout works in 3D. Click "Playground" at the top of the page. Would love to here what you think!

Show HN: MockMechanics is now open source
text:
Hey guys, a couple of years ago I posted about MockMechanics, a visual programming language/sandbox building game that I've been working on and there was a very positive response [0]. Since then I've been implementing most of the things I promised in my first youtube video [1] and making it ready for an open source release and I'm happy to say it's ready [2]. I've also been building new things and showing them in the youtube channel. It's written in clojure and you can use it to create all sorts of machines, games, musical instruments, etc using little to no code at all. You've seen the piano, the tetris game, the clock the combination safe and so on but since then I've built a 3d printer, a robotic hand, a bubble sorting algorithm, a 7 segment display, a ball cannon, a paint program and more, you can see all these things in the youtube channel [3]. [0] https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=24934722

[1] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HrwxbQj5mj0

[2] https://github.com/felipereigosa/mock-mechanics

[3] https://www.youtube.com/c/MockMechanics

Channel trailer with some of the new machines - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VQiA42ReNYE

Show HN: Groupd – an AI-assisted service for categorizing online content
text:
NOTE: the actual service is still actively being worked upon, but we have decided to publish the landing page as early as possible and get some early adopters.

During our work on http://murmel.social, we have come to the conclusion that AI assisted content classification can be a game-changing tool for small teams or knowledge professionals (journalists, researchers, writers, marketers, etc.) This is why we thought it would make sense to direct a part of efforts on sharing our in-house classification tooling with those people.

Even if you have absolutely no clue about content classification, or how it would help you, if you fall into of the groups above, you might want to sign up and get our further updates. We believe that we can help build a tool that people may not even know they needed.

Thanks for your support!

Ask HN: Anyone going to the GraphQL Summit next week in San Diego?
text:
The Oso team will be there and we'd like to meet some folks in person. We've found a lot of success with GraphQL users using our product to solve their authorization problem. Here's an article to read more: https://www.osohq.com/post/graphql-authorization

Feel free to reach out to me directly (erin at osohq dot com) if you're interested. Our co-founders, Graham Neray and Sam Scott will be there.

Cheers!
